intro: Rosa × dumetorum var. solstitialis, commonly known as the common dog玫瑰, is a hybrid species of rose native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring thorny stems and dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its botanical characteristics include a woody structure, simple leaves with serrated edges, and an aromatic scent. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and is adaptable to a range of environmental conditions.
